alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer; Dewey; Garfield; Kingfisher; Major; Roger Mills; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 02 at 5:28AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Washita, northwestern Kingfisher, southeastern Roger Mills, Custer, Blaine, eastern Dewey, southwestern Garfield and southern Major Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 528 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Longdale to near Butler. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Fairview, Taloga, Okeene, Thomas, Seiling, Arapaho, Canton, Custer City, Butler, Longdale, Ames, Hitchcock, Oakwood, Putnam, Canton Lake, Foss Reservoir and Orion. This includes Interstate 40 between mile markers 60 and 85. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Custer; Dewey; Garfield; Kingfisher; Major; Roger Mills; Washita
